sources.data_found: Installed GPU Hardware table lists per-node GPUs: gpu001 P100(2), gpu002 P100(2), gpu003 V100(2), gpu004 V100(2), gpu005 V100(2), gpu006 A100 40GB(2), gpu007 A100 40GB(2), gpu008 L40S(8), gpu009 L40S(2), gpu010 H100 NVL 94GB(1), gpu011 L40S(2).

Kodiak system summary (central HPC) lists GPU node types (older snapshot): 2×P100 nodes (2 GPUs/node), 3×V100 nodes (2 GPUs/node), 1×A100 node (2 GPUs/node) and notes condo model. Does not reflect newer L40S/H100 nodes shown on Kodiak_GPUs.

student_data.notes: Source is Baylor Office of Institutional Research report titled "Enrollment by Program and Major, Fall 2024" (IR Series Vol. 24-25, No. 004; dated September 24, 2024). Undergrad CS total (239) is the sum of Primary Program counts for: Computer Science (BSCS)=229 (Unit=Engineering & Computer Science), Computer Science Fellows (BSC)=1 (Unit=Engineering & Computer Science), and Computer Science (BA)=9 (Unit=Arts & Sciences). Graduate counts come from Primary Program (Unit=Graduate School): Computer Science (MS)=27 (masters only) and Computer Science (PHD)=24 (doctoral only).

gpu_resources.notes:
Cluster counted: Kodiak (central HPC + condo GPU nodes as listed on Kodiak_GPUs).
Per-node calculations:
- P100 16GB: gpu001 (1 node×2=2) + gpu002 (1×2=2) => 4 total P100
- V100: gpu003 (1×2=2) + gpu004 (1×2=2) + gpu005 (1×2=2) => 6 total V100
- A100 40GB: gpu006 (1×2=2) + gpu007 (1×2=2) => 4 total A100 40GB
- L40S 48GB: gpu008 (1×8=8) + gpu009 (1×2=2) + gpu011 (1×2=2) => 12 total L40S
- H100: gpu010 lists 'H100 NVL (1) 94GB' => 1 total H100; categorized as H100 PCIe (NVL form factor, not SXM).

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
